intro: Blakwellia antarctica, commonly known as the Antarctic blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to the Antarctic region. It is a small, low-growing shrub that thrives in the extreme cold and nutrient-poor soils of the continent. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that bloom during the brief Antarctic summer. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to retain moisture in the harsh environment. Blakwellia antarctica plays a minor but ecologically significant role in the sparse vegetation of Antarctica.
